1512212.content:
The slithering mess of tentacles made its way up one of the tall oak trees at the park's edge, easily moving up the rough surface with its long, slimy tendrils. It made its way over to one long, sturdy looking branch, and found a perfect vantage spot to look over the native life. Every one of the thing's long, many-segmented feelers had sensory organs scattered throughout, giving the creature a very detailed scope into the foreign world around it. It was especially useful for monitoring the gathering of humans nearby, and for detecting and analysing their physical forms.

The alien felt a modicum of surprise, as much as its emotionless state could allow. The humans had a gigantic variety of vessels, each one unique from the other. It didn't take long for the alien to identify similar features that corresponded between specific humans, and was able to surmise that some were more closely related genetically than they were from others. It also quickly grew to understand that this species seemed to have some sort of familial structure similar to the primitive creatures from its own homeworld. It began an analysis of the forms present, inspecting their flesh and using relevant data to determine which hosts were the most viable.

The tiny humans running around in the center of the field were immediately out, as it was reasonable for the alien to assume that these vessels would not be influential. Many of what seemed to be familial members to the young humans were possibilities, as the alien reasoned out how human physiognomy worked. There were some that seemed to be unhealthy, overweight or aged, all traits that the scout surmised would not be ideal for infiltration. So, the alien set its eyes on the adult humans that seemed to be fit, well muscled, and youthful. There were a few choice subjects, tall and powerful and seemingly acting with some sort of authority. These seemed to all be part of one sex, and once again the alien surmised that this was the sex that would likely fill the hunter or warrior class, if such a thing existed on this planet.

The alien was beginning to calculate which of these stronger humans would be the choice host when it observed one of them approaching one of the shorter, less muscled humans. This human seemed be of the opposite, less physically power sex, and looked to be the commander of half of the smaller humans, the ones who seemed to be engaged in some sort of game or lesson. Was this some sort of military indoctrination for the children? The children seemed to listen to this human, and the hunter/warrior that approached the leader seemed to acquiesce as well, smiling and giving off a body language that suggested that the hunter was looking for the leader’s approval. This posed a query to the alien, and it tried to understand why the larger specimens were so interested in the smaller leader.

It immediately guessed that it could be a matter of status or station, or perhaps the leader had a superior intellect. After all, it was in command of half of the little humans, which seemed to be a mark of distinction, as all the humans on the leader’s side of the field seemed to pay it respect, as with the other leader’s side. Though, the alien recognized, the hunter/warriors were not paying as much attention to the other leader. Why could this be?

The alien was now fascinated with the leader, and spent the rest of what was actually a simple game of soccer analysing this potential vector. The alien noted that while not as bulky or powerful as the hunters, the leader was very fit, its muscles and form well maintained and healthy. However, the leader had very large deposits of what the alien hypothesized to be some sort of fat stores on the front of its abdomen and at the top of each of its legs. But, the leader’s fat stores did not seem to hamper or hinder it in the same way that it did for some of the other adult humans, which were practically covered in the substance. The hunter that had approached the leader seemed especially interested in the fatty spheres partially hidden underneath the leader’s clothing, and seemed to glance down at them frequently. The leader seemed to notice, but did not visibly react. When the alien observed that the other human leader lacked these fatty deposits, understanding came to it.

A glimmer of predatory excitement flooded into the alien as it guessed that these fatty stores might be reproductive centers. The alien knew that it could very likely take advantage of this, and immediately began to consider all of the possibilities that this could entail. It knew that there was the distinct possibility that it could find a way of reproducing using the human’s body, and could even find a way of spreading its offspring to some of these hunter/warrior types that were so interested in the leader. The shear prospect of a host with some sort of social prestige that was also sexually viable to other members of the species sent jitters of anticipation through it, causing its tentacles to shift and slither excitedly.

You slithered out of your vessel, eager to plant your tendrils in a new ecosystem, tasting the surrounding vegetation as threads of yourself spread out and consumed the plants. You were once not so different from the humans of this world, until you discovered the planet that assimilated you and your crewmates. Before, the world-spanning mass of ever-changing flesh had little more than animal intelligence, but with your minds it gained purpose, and the technology to spread to the stars, under the guidance of your former captain, now Queen. Your bodies could be changed, discarded, or re-created from any part of the super-organism's mass, and that extended even to the city-sized structures that you could manipulate as extensions of yourselves. Now you were a lonely ball of tentacles barely the size of a potato, busily consuming the plant life in your vicinity.

You had to use most of your acquired biomass to make a thick layer of foliage to cover your ship.. Extending roots into the ground, you could feel and hear the approaching footsteps, giving you little time to finish. You would have to be stealthy, at least until you were sure you had overgrown the humans' capacity to wipe you out with their nuclear weapons. One of the plants you absorbed gave you an idea.

Estimating the likely path of whoever was coming, you planted yourself and morphed into a wild raspberry bush along the trail. You made your berries a little larger and riper than normal for this time of the year, hoping they would lure your visitors in. Then you could either ensnare them right there, or let them eat your berries and infect them more slowly.
